name: MSCRMPluginRegistration
description: Updates a CDS Plugin/Workflow activity assembly/types/steps in a PowerApps/CDS/Dynamics 365 environment
author: Wael Hamze
helpMarkDown: Upsert plugin/workflow assembly, types and steps

inputs.name: registrationType
inputs.label: Registration Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upsert: Updates existing assembly/types/steps and creates if not present.  Reset: Deletes existing assembly/types/steps and re-creates everything.  Delsert: Deletes types/steps not present in json followed by Upsert

inputs.name: assemblyPath
inputs.label: Assembly path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of assembly to be register.

inputs.name: solutionName
inputs.label: CRM solution name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Unique name of solution to which plugin/workflow assembly has to be register.

inputs.name: useSplitAssembly
inputs.label: Split Plugin Assembly
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to true to split plugin assembly.

inputs.name: mappingFile
inputs.label: Mapping File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Plugin registration json/xml mapping used to register assembly/types/steps.  Mapping json file sample can be found [here](https://github.com/WaelHamze/xrm-ci-framework/blob/master/MSDYNV9/Xrm.Framework.CI/Xrm.Framework.CI.Common/PluginRegistration/PluginAssemblyExample.json).  JSON schema which will help you to generate plugin registration mapping can be found [here](https://github.com/WaelHamze/xrm-ci-framework/blob/master/MSDYNV9/Xrm.Framework.CI/Xrm.Framework.CI.Common/PluginRegistration/PluginRegistrationSchema.json).  How to use schema can be found [here](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/webdev/2014/04/10/intellisense-for-json-schema-in-the-json-editor/).  To generate plugin registration JSON mapping from existing assembly/type/steps from a specific solution, please use this [script](https://github.com/WaelHamze/xrm-ci-framework/blob/master/MSDYNV9/Xrm.Framework.CI/Xrm.Framework.CI.PowerShell.Scripts/GetPluginRegistration.ps1).
